summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the legal procedure following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It discusses whether to dismiss the indictment against Epstein and if that dismissal would be a nolle prosequi.

events.title: Internal DOJ discussion on Epstein case procedure
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails discussing the legal procedure to follow after Jeffrey Epstein's death, specifically whether to dismiss the indictment and if that constitutes a nolle prosequi.

keyFacts: The email exchange occurred on August 10, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The discussion centers on whether to dismiss the indictment against Epstein posthumously.
The legal term 'nolle prosequi' (nolle) is considered as the potential mechanism for dismissal.
The correspondence indicates standard procedure would be to dismiss the indictment when a defendant dies after indictment but before conviction.
The email is from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's Public Affairs office.
